answers.answer: Hey Cheyenne,Unfortunately, fatigue is very common issue for pwMS day to day basis as well as during relapses but there are a plethora of other causes of fatigue and because you already have a dx of sleep apnea and have consciously been loosing weight (well done btw), you've got two potential explanations already.Most of the more common causes (eg vitamin deficiency - Iron, vit B, diabetes, hypoglycaemia, infections etc  etc) can easily be exclude with basic blood tests, and i think it would be a good idea to see your family doctor to get it check out, 'just in case' there is something amiss that you can tweek to get back to normal.Cheers..........JJ
Thanks JJ.... ya I just had a plethora of blood work and all is well... but I am just trying to muddle through...Thanks for you kind and educated reply:)

question: Hi all...Has anyone had severe fatigue be the main/only symptom in a relapse??I have literally been falling asleep while driving to work in the mornings (AFTER 2 lg coffees),having to take a nap at lunch (I only did this one other time 6 years ago bf I knew I had sleep apnea, which the dr and I feel is resolved now since losing 90 pounds). I feel better at times, like while working, but as soon as I'm just sitting I'm ready to pass out.My other symptoms I have had are some pins and needles in my face especially around my left eye (where I had abnormal VEP in feb, but was normal beg.
